title: The Revolution as Authority in Iran

content.question: Which of the following best describes the speaker’s perspective about the authority of Iran’s government?

choices.label: Election results are more important than Iran’s theocracy as a source of authority.
The leadership of Iran uses the revolution of 1979 and election results as a source of authority.
The office of president should have more authority than the office of supreme leader in Iran.
The regime will always support election results, even if those results lead to governmental instability.

content.answer: The leadership of Iran uses the revolution of 1979 and election results as a source of authority.

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Describe the author's claim(s), perspective, evidence, and reasoning.
